page.title: 04Industry: Phurnacite Plant.
page.content:
The Phurnacite plant is situated in Aberaman. The plant went into production in 1942 and presently employs approximately 900 men. It makes a high grade domestic smokeless fuel called "Phurnacite", using dry steam coal produced by local collieries. Phurnacite is distributed throughout the British Isles, its biggest market is London and South-East England
Over recent years the pollution emitted from the Plant has increased, because the process has fallen into disrepair. This has caused friction between the local residents and the owners National Smokeless Fuels. Despite dust suppression processes,the emission of dust, smells and airborne tar, they have to be suffered because of the jobs at stake.
